channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: A net theoretic approach to homotopy theory
item.description: arXiv:2410.18245v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: This paper uses a net-theoretic approach to convergence spaces, aimed to simplify the description of continuous convergence in order to apply it in problems concerning Homotopy Theory. We present methods for handling homotopies of limit spaces, define fundamental groupoids, and prove a generalized version of the Seifert-van Kampen Theorem for limit spaces.
item.dc:creator: Renan Maneli Mezabarba, Rodrigo Santos Monteiro, Thales Fernando Vilamaior Paiva

item.title: An Isometric Embedding of a Bounded Set in a Euclidean Space into the Gromov-Hausdorff Space
item.description: arXiv:2410.18442v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We construct an isometric embedding of a bounded set in a Euclidean space into the Gromov-Hausdorff space. In particular, we can embed a bounded and connected Riemannian manifold into the Gromov-Hausdorff space by a bilipschitz map.
item.dc:creator: Takuma Byakuno

item.title: Locally hulled topologies
item.description: arXiv:2410.18509v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We present a general result about generating group topologies by pseudo-norms. Namely, we show that if a topology has a base of sets which are closed in a certain sense, then it can be generated by a collection of pseudo-norms such that the balls in these pseudo-norms are also closed in the same sense. The examples include linear and locally convex topologies on vector spaces, locally solid and Fatou topologies on vector lattices and Fr\'echet-Nikod\'ym topologies on Boolean algebras.
item.dc:creator: Eugene Bilokopytov
